DataElement.preferredDefinition: The end of the discharge or emanation of data or image with a sensing device recorded in military time format, e.g. 1:00 pm = 1300 hrs.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The end of the discharge or emanation of data or image with a sensing device._The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image.

Concepts.definition: The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image.

Property.preferredDefinition: Put an end to a state or an activity.

Concepts.definition: Put an end to a state or an activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/13/13 Replaced C71894:C17999 with C94892 (Emission Scan). jc 10/8/13 removed "manually-curated" from definition. jc  4/9/09 released for use in VCU C3D. 2/5/08 - DEC updated.  12/20/07 created for ACRIN PET, U of  WASH FES, FMISO studies

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the continuum in which events pass from the future through the present to the past recorded in military time format, e.g. 1:00 pm = 1300 hrs.  [Manually-curated]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The armed forces of a country.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
